page.title: 01Coast of Whitby Fog Signal
page.content: Only the extreme south west is on land, the rest of the block is over the sea. The rocky inter tidal zone rises in a 200ft high cliff which is topped by hilly farmland, predominantly grassland,but some other crops. The Cleveland way footpath passes along the coast here, very popular with visitors onfoot due to its close proximity to Whitby and nearby caravan sites. The few residents live at Ling Hill farm, and also at the lighthouse. This area is important to the coastal shipping as it contains a lighthouse and large foghorn. The high cliffs and viewpoints from the nearby hills provide spectacuar views of the rugged and unspoilt coast line to the south east which is both National parkland Heritage coast and valued by visitors for its lack of development
